title: Implementation of the Energy and Infrastructure Provisions of the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to effectively implement the energy and infrastructure parts of the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022. It establishes a White House office and strengthens interagency coordination to promote clean energy innovation, create good jobs, reduce energy costs, and advance environmental and climate justice while addressing the climate crisis.
potential_concerns: The prioritization of clean energy and union-focused jobs may disadvantage energy-sector workers in oil, gas, and coal industries who may face job losses or reduced opportunities.
Mandates for prevailing wages and registered apprenticeships might increase costs or limit participation for non-union workers and small businesses lacking union affiliation.

Environmental justice communities and tribal communities might face challenges ensuring meaningful engagement and equitable benefit-sharing from new infrastructure projects despite the policyâ€™s emphasis on justice.
Low-income families may experience benefits from reduced energy costs, but implementation complexity or delays could slow access to affordable energy solutions.

Rural communities, while targeted for economic revitalization and nature-based solutions, might experience unequal distribution of resources compared to urban areas, exacerbating regional disparities.
